summary: This is a declaration filed by a BOP Staff Attorney in support of the Bureau of Prisons' motion for summary judgment in a FOIA lawsuit brought by The New York Times. The declaration details the extensive searches conducted at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) for records related to Jeffrey Epstein's incarceration, suicide attempt, and death, revealing that many key records (like SHU logs and video footage) were handed over to investigative agencies.

persons.name: Kara Christenson
persons.context: BOP Government Information Specialist at the Central Office with whom the declarant communicated regarding the FOIA requests. Her separate declaration details searches of central BOP systems.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The deceased inmate who was housed at the MCC. The entire FOIA search was for records pertaining to his incarceration, suicide attempt, suicide, and related administrative processes.

connections.description: Christenson, as a BOP Government Information Specialist, was responsible for coordinating central office searches for records related to Epstein in response to a FOIA request.

events.title: Epstein's First Suicide Attempt
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein's first reported suicide attempt while incarcerated at the MCC. The FOIA request seeks records from this date, including SHU logs and staff augmentation records.

events.title: Epstein's Suicide
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein died by suicide while incarcerated at the MCC. The FOIA request seeks extensive records from this date and the following day.

events.title: FBI Takes Possession of Video Footage
events.description: The Federal Bureau of Investigation took possession of all video camera footage from the MCC pertinent to Epstein's suicide and first suicide attempt.

events.title: OIG Takes Possession of Log Books
events.description: The Office of the Inspector General took possession of the Special Housing Unit (SHU) log books and visitor log books related to Epstein's incarceration.

events.title: Recorded Visitor for Epstein
events.description: A visitor log book shows a visitor for Jeffrey Epstein on this date, which was after his death, suggesting a possible data entry or record-keeping anomaly.

keyFacts: Key physical evidence, including SHU log books and all video camera footage from the MCC related to Epstein's suicide and first attempt, was handed over to the OIG and FBI in August 2019, prior to the FOIA request.
The declaration states that no meeting minutes or record of a formal meeting to decide on removing Epstein from suicide watch could be located, despite searches of relevant staff.
BOP determined that no recordings were made of Epstein's telephone calls, including his last three calls.
Searches located memoranda regarding calls Epstein made on legal lines, but no systematic call log was found.
The FOIA request reveals the extensive scope of records sought about Epstein's incarceration, including disciplinary records, medical reports, visitor lists, and staff meeting documents.
